ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Number of days from study baseline to date of visit
In the past month, has the patienIt lived in the community (i.e., not hospitalized, or in day treatment)?
Name first medication that the participant has taken
How many pills of did the doctor tell you to take each day?
Notes: -1=Properly skipped; -2=Not collected at this time point; -8=Unsure/Don't know/Unable to assess; -9=Missing

ElementDescription: Over the past month, on how many days did you NOT TAKE (Name of first antipsychotic)?
Notes: 1=Few, if any (less than 7); 2=7-13; 3=14-20; 4=Most (greater than 20); -1=Properly Skipped; -2= Not collected at this time point; -5= Item/instrument not collected; -6=Not applicable; -9=Missing

ElementDescription: Over the past month, how many days did you TAKE LESS THAN the prescribed number ofpills of (Name of first antipsychotic)?
Notes: 1=Always/Almost Always (76-100% of the time (poor adherence); 2=Usually (51-75% of the time); 3=Sometimes (26-50% of the time); 4= Never/Almost Never (0-25% of the time) (good adherence); -1= Properly skipped; -2= Not collected at this time point; -9= Missing

ElementDescription: Has the patient been prescribed a 2nd antipsychotic?
Name second medication that the participant has taken
How many pills did the doctor tell you to take each day?
Over the past month, on how many days did you NOT TAKE (Name of second antipsychotic)?
Notes: 1=Few, if any (less than 7); 2=7-13; 3=14-20; 4=Most (greater than 20); -1=Properly Skipped; -2= Not collected at this time point; -5= Item/instrument not collected; -6=Not applicable; -9=Missing

ElementDescription: Over the past month, how many days did you TAKE LESS THAN the prescribed number o fpills of (Name of second antipsychotic)?
Notes: 1=Always/Almost Always (76-100% of the time (poor adherence); 2=Usually (51-75% of the time); 3=Sometimes (26-50% of the time); 4= Never/Almost Never (0-25% of the time) (good adherence); -1= Properly skipped; -2= Not collected at this time point; -9= Missing

ElementDescription: Please place a single vertical line on the dotted line below that you believe best describes, out of the total # of prescribed antipsychotic medication doses, the proportion of doses taken by the patient in the past month.
Notes: Measured in percentages. How to calculate percent taken: Number taken divided by number of chances. Example 1: If patient takes 1 pill a day, then you divide number taken by 30. Example 2: If patient takes 2 pills a day, then you divide number taken by 60.-1= Properly skipped; -2= Not collected at this time point; -9=Missing; -8=Unknown; -6=Not applicable; -5=Item/Instrument not collected; -3=Historical missing

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
MetaTrial Visit ID
Notes: System variable: unique code for each type of visit -use to merge files

ElementDescription: Sequence Number
Notes:
The FSEQNO variable in the ADJ form has a special interpretation compared to other forms.
For example, ADJ FSEQNO of '1' can be thought of as being '001', FSEQNO of '2' can be thought of as
being '002', and FSEQNO of '3' can be thought of as being '003'.
The first digit of FSEQNO relates to the corresponding ENF sequence number at that visit and the third
digit relates to the specific adjudicator who completed the adjudication form.
